  But who gave them the order? Who
was the senior officer who, confronted
by th e danger of th o u sa n d s of
L iverpool fa n s m illin g o u tsid e
Hillsborough soccer ground, made the
agonising decision to let them in
causing the crush which left 94 dead
and 170 injured?
 As an investigation began into the tragedy South
Yorkshire police, who were responsible for order at
the FA Cup semi-final in Sheffield, refused to
answer all questions relating to the handling of
the disaster. In front of TV cameras from all over

tu rn into m akeshift stretchers. T hey led the

upon line of fans, certifying them dead.

was, simply, a m ortuary. Seventy people
from Liverpool, all dead and being placed
into body bags.’

                                                                                                                                         T W O C I T I E S IN M O U R N I N G



              Liverpool, Everton
FOOTBALL has closed down in Liverpool




                   call off
while the city mourns for the dead of
Hillsborough.
  Liverpool, the most successful club in the
history of English football, have suspended all
-.heir fixtures indefinitely. They may not play
again this season.
